p: Although mortality from measles has declined in sub-Saharan Africa, it remains a major public health problem in numerous countries like the Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC), with 294 455 cases including 5045 deaths reported between 2010 and 2013 [33], [34], [35]. A total of 186 178 patients (63%) were younger than 5 years old. After the first mass vaccination campaigns, weekly reported cases decreased by 21.5%. However, results of postvaccination campaign coverage surveys indicated suboptimal (less than 95%) vaccination coverage among children surveyed.
